intro: Tofieldia divergens, commonly known as the white fringed gentian, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers with white fringes. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and swamps. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Tofieldia divergens is often found in shaded environments and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
